attributes.action: Appoint a new ISC so the 'Russia Report' may be published without further delay.
attributes.additional_details: Doubts over Russian involvement in both the EU referendum and subsequent election campaigns are casting a shadow over the legitimacy of both Boris Johnson's government and Brexit itself. The general public has a right to know whether either of these have a watertight mandate from the electorate or if we are indeed being manipulated into acting against our interest by a hostile nation. The ISC was reappointed within 5 months of the 2017 election; in these troubled times this act is long overdue.
attributes.background: The Prime Minister stated in December that he had cleared the 'Russia Report' for publication and that it was in the hands of the Intelligence & Security Committee. But the ISC was dissolved before the election and the person responsible for appointing a new one is the PM! Let's get this done now!

rejection.details:
The Intelligence and Security Committee (ISC) published the report of its predecessor Committee into alleged Russian interference in UK elections on Tuesday 21 July.

You can read the report here: https://docs.google.com/a/independent.gov.uk/viewer?a=v&pid=sites&srcid=aW5kZXBlbmRlbnQuZ292LnVrfGlzY3xneDo1Y2RhMGEyN2Y3NjM0OWFl. 

We're sorry about the delay in checking your petition. The delay was due to the exceptionally large number of petitions we received between March and July.
